title: ASX lower; Michael Clarke to retire from Treasury
text:
Sarah Turner

Credit Suisse has cut airline Qantas to neutral from outperform ahead of a first-quarter firm’s trading update on October 24.

“We estimate capacity in the domestic airline market was up 0.4 per cent in the quarter, while investors may be expecting a capacity cut,” they said.

“We think the market is expecting large capacity cuts from Virgin that will be a significant benefit for Qantas,” the broker said.

It believes this is possible but noted there is limited evidence of this happening as yet and the cuts may be smaller and take longer to materialise than expected.

The broker didn’t change its estimates or target price of $6.40 a share.

Credit Suisse is also expecting a significant scaling back of the firm’s $400 million off-market buyback on November 4.

“We expect the scale back to be high and this is likely to be a slightly negative event for the shares,:” the broker said.

Still, the airline is expected to be included in the MSCI from November 27, with an announcement due on November 7.

“We estimate this is likely to generate $US195 million in additional demand for Qantas shares, it said.
description: Australian shares are trading lower this morning; Treasury's CEO Michael Clarke to retire; Afterpay welcomes RBA review; Seven Questions with Bianca Ogden.
